# to test the adder first i coverred basic edge cases by hand by checking if max and min int worked and also checked to see that Cin values of 0 and 1 worked and also checked to see that I made cases that have overflow of zero and 1 and have C values that are zero and nonzero.  This coverred the edge cases and most corner cases.  
# Then i just generated 300 more test cases using a python script to make sure that each bit was tested at 0 and 1 with varying Cin inputs and different magnitudes (based off the MSB).  This should cover the rest of the testing for this file and even cover some edge and corner cases by random chance.  All of the tests are in base 10s


A[32] B[32] Cin C[32] V

#edge cases and weird cases to ensure basic functionality
0 0 0 0 0  #all zeros edge case to ensure everything sums to zero 
2147483647 0 0 2147483647 0  # A  = max positive int plus zero case to ensure there is no overflow 
1 -1 0 0 0 # sum of positive and negative number to ensure adding poitive to a negative works and to see that we can correctly sum to zero
-2147483648 0 0 -2147483648 0 #sum of most negative number and zero to ensure there is no overflow here 
2147483647 0 1 2147483648 1 # sum of max positive number and zero with Cin of 1 to ensure it detects overflow in the case where adding in Cin just just causes overflow
-2147483648 0 1 -2147483647 0 #sum of most negative number and zero with a Cin of 1
2147483647 2147483647 0 4294967294 1 # sum of most positive numbers 
40000 -60000 1 -19999 0 # testng case where Cin=1 does not cause overflow, the answer is negative, and A and B are different signs

# 300 python randomly generated test cases
